name: Cliffwatch
culture_adjustments: lookout and watch rites dominate daily schedule
stronger clan/boathouse orientation over large guild halls
rituals timed to micro-tide cycles unique to local reefs
heightened suspicion of strangers and passing merchant crews
oral laments emphasize shipwreck survival and cliff rescue
constraints: ritual magic dependent on imported reagents
industrial work constrained by cliff access and low-pressure tech
notes: seasonal festivals tied to spring tides
pilots function as semi-guild agents for long-distance trade
local economy ties reef reagents to distant ritual markets
